dfischer.utils

Class PKCS11Config

  • java.lang.Object
    • dfischer.utils.PKCS11Config

  • public class PKCS11Config
extends java.lang.Object
    Allows to configure a PKCS#11 security device and grants access to the embedded X509 certificates and their private keys.
    See Also:
    PKCS11ConfigCertificateItem, HttpSocketPool.setClientCredentials(java.security.cert.X509Certificate[], java.security.PrivateKey)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String PKCS11_CONFIG_FILENAME
      The (internal) file name which is used by the Proxy Sniffer GUI to store the PKCS#11 configuration data.

      Constructors

      PKCS11Config()
      Create a new instance.

    • Field Detail

      • PKCS11_CONFIG_FILENAME

        public static final java.lang.String PKCS11_CONFIG_FILENAME
        The (internal) file name which is used by the Proxy Sniffer GUI to store the PKCS#11 configuration data. value = "prxsniff.pkcs11auth".
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        public PKCS11Config()
        Create a new instance.

    • Method Detail

      • setActive

        public void setActive(boolean isActive)
        Mark the PKCS#11 configuration as active or inactive.
        Parameters:
        isActive - true = mark the PKCS#11 configuration as active

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Return if the PKCS#11 configuration is marked as active.
        Returns:
        true if the PKCS#11 configuration is marked as active, else false

      • setOsLibraryFileName

        public void setOsLibraryFileName(java.lang.String osLibraryFileName)
        Set the file name of the operating-system-specific library.
        Parameters:
        osLibraryFileName - the file name of the operating-system-specific library (plain file name without path), or an empty string or null if no operating-system-specific library is available.

      • getOsLibraryFileName

        public java.lang.String getOsLibraryFileName()
        Return the file name of the operating-system-specific library (plain file name without path).
        Returns:
        the file name of the operating-system-specific library, or an empty string if no operating-system-specific library is available

        Set the file name of the device-specific library.
        Parameters:
        deviceLibraryFileName - the file name of the device-specific library (plain file name without path), or an empty string or null if no device-specific library is available.

        public java.lang.String getDeviceLibraryFileName()
        Return the file name of the device-specific library (plain file name without path).
        Returns:

        public void setPin(java.lang.String pin)
        Set the PIN (password) of the PKCS#11 device.
        Parameters:

      • getPin

        public java.lang.String getPin()
        Return the PIN (password) of the PKCS#11 device.
        Returns:
        the PIN (password) of the PKCS#11 device, or an empty string if no PIN was set

      • setSlotNumber

        Returns:
        the slot number of the PKCS#11 device

      • setSelectCertIndex

        public void setSelectCertIndex(int selectCertIndex)
        Select a certificate by using an index-number. Note: this information is not used (not required) to configure a PKCS#11 security device.
        Parameters:
        selectCertIndex - index-number of certificate. Valid numbers are starting from 0 (zero).
        See Also:
        getSelectCertIndex()

      • getSelectCertIndex

        public int getSelectCertIndex()
        Return the index of the selected certificate.
        Returns:
        the index of the selected certificate (0,1,..) or -1 if no certificate was selected.
        See Also:
        setSelectCertIndex(int selectCertIndex)

      • getCertificateItems

        public PKCS11ConfigCertificateItem[] getCertificateItems()
        Return all X509 certificates and private keys which are stored in the PKCS#11 device.
        Returns:
        all X509 certificates and private keys which are stored in the PKCS#11 device, or null if acquireCertificateItems() never was called before.
        See Also:
        acquireCertificateItems()

      • isLibraryFileNameWithoutPath

        public static boolean isLibraryFileNameWithoutPath(java.lang.String libraryFileName)
        Utility: check if a file name of a library is formal valid and contains no path.
        Parameters:
        libraryFileName - file name of a library
        Returns:
        true if a file name of a library is formal valid and contains no path

      • acquireCertificateItems

        public void acquireCertificateItems()
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Acquire all X509 certificates (inclusive private keys) which are stored in the PKCS#11 device. This method removes first all existing PKCS#11 security providers and adds then a new one.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        getCertificateItems()

      • acquireCertificateItems

        public void acquireCertificateItems(boolean cleanupPreviousPkcs11Providers)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Acquire all X509 certificates (inclusive private keys) which are stored in the PKCS#11 device.
        Parameters:
        cleanupPreviousPkcs11Providers - if set to true remove first all existing PKCS#11 security providers and then add then a new one (recommended). If several PKCS#11 hardware devices are used at the same time you must set this parameter to false.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
        See Also:
        getCertificateItems()

      • writeObject

        public void writeObject(java.io.DataOutputStream dout)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Write the object to a stream (binary format).
        Note: this includes also the acquired X509 certificates but does not include the private keys.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readObject

        public void readObject(java.io.DataInputStream din)
                throws java.io.IOException,
                       java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Read the object from a stream (binary format).
        Note: this includes also the acquired X509 certificates but does not include the private keys.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException

      • writeObjectToFile

        public void writeObjectToFile(java.io.File f)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Write the configuraton data to a file (in ASCII/text format) and store the PIN in Base64 format.
        Note: this does not include the acquired X509 certificates.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeObjectToFile

        public void writeObjectToFile(java.io.File f,
                     boolean usePlainPin)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Write the configuraton data to a file (in ASCII/text format).
        Note: this does not include the acquired X509 certificates.
        Parameters:
        usePlainPin - if true, store the PIN as plain text instead of using the Base64 format
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • readObjectFromFile

        public void readObjectFromFile(java.io.File f)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Read the configuraton data from a file (from ASCII/text format).
        Note: this does not include the acquired X509 certificates.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • dumpConfigToStdout

        public void dumpConfigToStdout()
        Dump the configuration data to stdout.

        Internal test utility.
